awd_titl_txt: New Developments in Marine Science and Technology: Economic,Legal, and Political Aspects of Change
awd_abstract_narration: The Law-of-the-Sea Institute (LSI) will sponsor a conference in 1988 on         "New Developments in Marine Science and Technology" with a focus on the         implications of these developments on the economy, policies, and law of         the nations of the world.  The conference will consider among others the        following: improved capabilities for prediction of atmospheric and              oceanic climate; increased utilization of marine resources; new stresses        on the marine environment; use of ocean energy; and increased needs and         capabilities for conducting marine research.  Then, the conference will         consider the impact of these changes on the global economy and that of          individual nations; international and national policies for use and             management of the ocean; and the international legal regime for the             oceans.
